sentences.english: Of long standing, Confucianism is the core of Chinese Culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想淵遠流長，構成中國民族文化的核心。

sentences.english: The mean is an important intension of the Confucian school.
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想中的一個重要內容。

sentences.english: Human nature is an important constituent of the Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 人性論是儒家思想的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Discussion on justice of the mean by Confucius;
sentences.chinese: 中庸是儒家思想的一個重要組成部分。

sentences.english: But Confucianism revived, with its softer approach to power. Bell says that like the first emperor, the early communists struggled to consolidate their power.
sentences.chinese: 但是儒家思想因其推崇以柔克剛的權力手段得以復興。

sentences.english: Confucianism is still respected that there are temples that have Budda Confucius all together.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想仍然受到尊敬，各地有許多孔聖人的廟。

sentences.english: Thought , aspiration that judging from Confucian learning, he has to go into the society actively become an official.
sentences.chinese: 從儒家思想上看，他有積極入世的思想，渴望出仕。

sentences.english: But Confucianism revived, with its softer approach to power.
sentences.chinese: 但是儒家思想因其推崇以柔克剛的權力手段得以復興。

sentences.english: Confucius is the essence of Confucianism to give Jade a, clarifying Tamaari 11 Germany.
sentences.chinese: 孔子將儒家思想的精髓賦予玉一身，闡明玉有十一德。

sentences.english: Confucianism didn't become widely known across China until the Han Dynasty; under emperor Wu.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想直到漢朝纔在中國得到廣泛傳播。

sentences.english: Confucianism is one of the spiritual resources for us to solve the ecological crisis.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想是我們解決生態危機的精神資源之一。
然而，中國依舊受着儒家思想的影響。

sentences.english: Confucian values see man as an integral part of nature.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想把人當做自然的有機組成部分。

sentences.english: B:Confucianism is the backbone of Chinese culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想是中國傳統文化的主幹。

sentences.english: The third part of folk belief Confucianist thought.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分民間信仰中的儒家思想。

sentences.english: So the Confucianism is the main thoughts of FaYan.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，儒家思想是《法言》一書的主流思想。

definition: Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucianism
Confucianism

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
Confucius and Mencius
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
system of thought/ideology
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
Dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucian (idiom)/sole dominant ideology
pinyin: ba4 chu4 bai3 jia1 , du2 zun1 ru2 shu4

definition: Confucian

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
cultural tradition
